conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on the system using principles of mechanics.
The diagram shows a metal guide rail at an angle α with a groove containing a small ball, a rope connected to a pillow, and a child holding the pillow.
The angle between the rope and the vertical direction is β, and β remains constant.
Mass of the pillow is m1, mass of the child is m2, and mass of the small ball, the rope, and air resistance are ignored.
The child and pillow slide down together along the guide rail.
Identify the forces: gravitational force on the pillow (m1), gravitational force on the child (m2), tension in the rope (T), and normal force on the child (N).
Gravitational force on the pillow is F_g1 = m1 * g.
Gravitational force on the child is F_g2 = m2 * g.
Tension in the rope is T.
Normal force exerted by the pillow on the child is N.
Vertical component of the tension in the rope is T * cos(β).
Vertical component of the gravitational force on the pillow is m1 * g.
For the pillow to be in equilibrium: T * cos(β) = m1 * g.
Horizontal component of the tension in the rope is T * sin(β).
Horizontal component of the gravitational force on the child is m2 * g * sin(α).
For the child to be in equilibrium: T * sin(β) = m2 * g * sin(α).
Solve for the tension in the rope: T = m1 * g / cos(β).
Solve for the normal force: N = m2 * g * sin(α).
Find the ratio of the tension to the normal force: T/N = (m1 / (m2 * cos(β) * sin(α))).
The ratio of the tension of the rope to the force exerted by the pillow on the child is m1 / (m2 * cos(β) * sin(α)).
